block.p: Alexandra Louise Cohen, a daughter of Dr. Ilene Cohen and Dr. Neal Cohen of New York, was married last evening to Jonathan Bacon Oblak, a son of Janiece Oblak and Dr. John Oblak of Belmont, Calif. Calvin Bernstein, a Universal Life minister and a great-uncle of the bride, officiated at the nondenominational ceremony at the Rose Inn in Ithaca, N.Y.
The bride graduated from the University of Vermont, and the bridegroom graduated from Cornell. They both received law degrees from Cornell, the bridegroom, magna cum laude.

Alexandra Louise Cohen, a daughter of Dr. Ilene Cohen and Dr. Neal Cohen of New York, was married last evening to Jonathan Bacon Oblak, a son of Janiece Oblak and Dr. John Oblak of Belmont, Calif. Calvin Bernstein, a Universal Life minister and a great-uncle of the bride, officiated at the nondenominational ceremony at the Rose Inn in Ithaca, N.Y.
The bride graduated from the University of Vermont, and the bridegroom graduated from Cornell. They both received law degrees from Cornell, the bridegroom, magna cum laude.

Mrs. Oblak, 29, is an associate in the New York office of Latham & Watkins, the Los Angeles law firm. Her father is the New York City health commissioner. Her mother is the director of psychology at Bellevue Hospital Center in New York.

Mr. Oblak, 27, is a law clerk for Judge Joseph L. Tauro of the United States District Court in Boston. In September, he is to become an associate in the New York office of the Los Angeles law firm of Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher. His mother retired as the director of Cornell Tradition, an undergraduate fellowship program at the university. His father was until May the vice president for student affairs at Ithaca College; he began last month as the president of the College of Notre Dame in Belmont.
